title: Climatology
text:
Create local directory
In VS Code, install

Git
Quarto
Remote - SSH (should also install “Remote - SSH: Editing Configuration Files” and “Remote Explorer”)

Create Containerfile (or Dockerfile)
Create requirements.txt
In VS Code:

Open the project directory: File > Open Folder…
View > Command Palette… > Dev Containers: Open Folder in Container > select project folder > select Dockerfile

THe Docker image will now be built. This may take awhile the first time.

title: Local Climatologies
text: This site presents daily and monthly averages and records of NOAA CO-OPS weather and tide observations at different locations along the U.S. East Coast. Current sites are updated daily; archived sites are updated less frequently. This project is inspired by Brian McNoldy at the University of Miami, whose long-standing “Climatology of Virginia Key, FL” site never ceased to provide insightful weather perspectives during my time at the Rosenstiel School of Marine, Atmospheric, and Earth Science.

title: Local Climatologies
text: This site presents daily and monthly averages and records of NOAA CO-OPS weather and tide observations at different locations along the U.S. East Coast. Current sites are updated daily; archived sites are updated less frequently. This project is inspired by Brian McNoldy at the University of Miami, whose long-standing “Climatology of Virginia Key, FL” site never ceased to provide insightful weather perspectives during my time at the Rosenstiel School of Marine, Atmospheric, and Earth Science.
